description:
In essex-4,  when an instance is launched using the nova command,  the "user_id" of the instances table of the nova database contains the user's id. But when an instance is launched using the euca-run-instances command, the "user_id" of the instances table contains the user's access_key.

There is the same problem is the key_pairs table and perhaps on other tables where is defined a user_id column.
title: In essex-4: bad link to users table into nova database when using euca-xxx commands

comments.content:
In essex-4,  when an instance is launched using the nova command,  the "user_id" of the instances table of the nova database contains the user's id. But when an instance is launched using the euca-run-instances command, the "user_id" of the instances table contains the user's access_key.

There is the same problem is the key_pairs table and perhaps on other tables where is defined a user_id column.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~philippe-berthault-deactivatedaccount

comments.content:
This is expected behavior with noauth.  No auth does not track users and since e2 only has an access key, it just uses the access_key for user_id. In order to use noauth and achieve consistent results across the apis, you can set your access key to:
'<userid>:<projectid>'

The user_id is set correctly using keystone or deprecated auth.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~vishvananda
